intro: Spirillus foliosus var. niagarensis, commonly known as the Niagara spirillum, is a rare and unique variant of the Spirillus foliosus species. It is characterized by its spirally twisted, leaf-like structures that form a dense, curling rosette. The plant exhibits a striking coloration, with deep green foliage that often has a metallic sheen under sunlight. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or streamside habitats. Due to its rarity and distinctive morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
